Found the solution for those who can't start any event or the game crashes in car selection menus - Recently is the common problem even on EA forums and it might be patched this week. For now it is about quad cores - that the game can't handle.. All you have to do is reduce NFS11.EXE process access down from 4 to 2 cores.

Damn, getting the same "Black screen on actual game start" - probably because I have a multicored system. 

The fix for it is; Ctrl + Alt + Del and then right click on the NFS.exe and "Set affinity" in the process list. Then choosing eiter core 0 or core 1. At least so I read.

BUT I can't do it. Says something about not being able to set affinity as I'm not authorized to do so. (Rough translation from Finnish, as that's my system language...) 

Tried running as an administrator and setting the affinity but won't let me do it no matter what I try. 

Any help would be appreciated...

(Is it because I'm trying to set the affinity to a cracked .exe? hmmm or do I somehow have to allow this "affinity setting" from somewhere? 

Or is there a (cracked) patch or something around?

There's a list of fixes and solutions at the link below that might help some of you having problems running need for speed hot pursuit: 

http://www.gamebrood.com/2010/11/17/need-for-speed-hot-pursuit-pc-fix-and-fixes-for-crashes-freezes-errors-graphics-glitches-connection-problems-low-performance-and-many-other-technical-problems/

I hope this helps.

How to fix the crash:
1. Use this crack http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5959999/Need.for.Speed.Hot.Pursuit-Crack-%5Btracker.BTARENA.org
2. DISABLE or turn-off any anti-aliasing settings in your graphic software. Ex: in ATI Catalyst control panel, set 3D quality to Balanced
Now it shouldn't crash when you launch the career race
